III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules,
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding the internal checklist used to ensure all
required information is in the report as it pertains to ensuring the correct
language is included regarding background checks.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The one CAP was submitted in response to the 10/30/2024 licensing inspection
report and was approved on 11/27/2024. That CAP addressed the agency's need
to secure an independent financial auditor. The CAP was successful as evidenced
by an independent auditor completing a financial audit for this inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment

The chief administrator assessment was received and reviewed during the
entrance meeting. The chief administrator identified compliance with licensing
requirements during her review of the work completed during the period under
review.
Financial Overview
An independent auditor's report dated July 23, 205, statement of financial position,
statement of activities, statement of functional expenses, statement of cash flows
and notes to financial statements were received and reviewed. No financial
concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
No concerns were identified during the entrance meeting and interviews. Other
than an increase in staffing, no changes were reported regarding the agency
during the period under review.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency appears to have the space and equipment to provide for the delivery
of adoption services. Physical CHRI is stored securely within a locked cabinet
separate from other files and a cross shredder is located within the office. All
physical CHRI is stored at the agency's main location. Adoption files are stored
within locked file cabinets.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
